text: If your iPhone is not charging properly,

it may be because your
charging port is filled
with too much debris.

Here are the steps you
should take to properly clean
your phone's charging port.
First, power off your iPhone completely.
You should get a flashlight
or work under a bright LED lamp.

You can clean it with
compressed air first,
and if this doesn't work,
you can use a wooden toothpick.

Never insert anything harder
than the wooden toothpick
in the iPhone's lightening port.

This is so you don't damage
the delicate electronics
within the port.

Let's start first with
using compressed air.
Holding the compressed air can upright
so it doesn't expel wet propellant,

shoot a few short, controlled
bursts of air into the port,
then try to charge it again.

If it's still not working, move
on to trying the toothpick.
Gently insert the toothpick into the port

and lightly scrape it against
the inside wall of the port.
After using the toothpick for a while,

give the port another
burst of compressed air
to help remove anything you've loosened,
then try to charge it again.
Hopefully, after a few cycles of cleaning,
your phone will start to charge.
If not, take it to an Apple service center
for professional help.
